lines.text: Well I certainly want to deactivate the Gumby robot.
Somebody kidnapped him, that's for sure. They made a robot copy of him. We've got to catch up with Gumby and tell him.
Your car is a real clunker. It won't start.
Don't get in the truck. That's not Gumby! It's a robot. It'll lock you in there the way Gumby was kidnapped. Run!

[the robot Gumby lifts up the car]
That's not Gumby for sure.
Time to head for the hills.
Hey, wait a minute. This could be dangerous. Let's call the police.
No time for that, Prickle. Just stick together and we'll be okay.
What's that TV truck doing here?
Oh, Mr. Claybert, that's not a TV truck. Gumby and the Clayboys were kidnapped in it.
Yeah. We don't know where they are.
We know where they are.
Whoever kidnapped him made a robot copy to fool us.
Hey, Thinbuckle, I wanna ride in the cab!
Goo has been kidnapped by the robot that looks just like you. It just drove away with Goo locked in the van.

[about a woman about to lose her home]
Gosh, it must be awful, isn't it, Prickle?
It just shows you that to borrow money is dangerous.
Boy, that driver must think he's going to a fire.
I wish we were going to a fire. This air conditioning is freezing.
[Thinbuckle yawns and then falls asleep]
I'm cold and stiff, I can't move!
[while thinking of a solution for a fundraiser]

[to Fatbuckle]
Fatbuckle, I like the sound of "farmer's benefits". So, is it settled? We'll have benefit concerts?
I'm all for it!
I'm all for it!
Oh my! This music does things to my brain!
It does things to my spine!
It makes me feel funny all over!
This is going to rock this scientific world.
Oh no, the door is locked.
I saw the blockheads use a key card here.
I'll get it from one of them.
I'll tell you, it's cold in here; colder than a witch's heart. Must be a light switch here some way.
I found a robot that made soup!
Hey, fellas! What do you know? Our first break on TV! Lucky sure works fast.
[drumbeat]
Man, our first TV appearance!
[guitar solo]
Wow! Think I should get a haircut?
Uh oh. Looks like Gumby is up to something, as usual.
You got ears, Pokey. Maybe you can overhear what they're saying.
I'm not interested.
Take this back. and bring me another thick shake. And get your circuits fixed before you make another mess.
It's my fault, I told that robot I wanted to meet you, not eat you.
One stinking dog coming up.
[repeated line]
Holy Toledo!
[after Pokey, Prickle, and Goo got fused together into a multi-character clay ball]
I won't believe it. It can't be true!
"To believe or not to believe?" That is a question.
You'd better start believing it 'cause I'm uncomfortable! Now everybody pull themselves together... I... I mean "apart".
Impossible, Goo. Somebody call an ambulance.
Gumby robot? Hey! That's our barn on the screen. And my car!
Yeah, there's a robot at your barn that looks exactly like you. And the monitor is showing you what it sees.
[Tara and Ginger arrive just in time at the farm before the robot Gumby attempts to kidnap Pokey, Prickle, and Goo]
Don't get in the truck! That's not Gumby, it's a robot! It'll lock you in there the way Gumby was kidnapped! Run!
[a robot waiter knocks over Prickle's milkshake]

[annoyed]
That robot REALLY has his wires crossed...
[Gumbo slides down the fireman's pole trampling Pokey]
Pokey, when are you going to learn not to stand by this pole?

[looking at a Clayboys poster]
Clayboys, Schmayboys. Who cares anyhow?
[at the benefit concert, giving their opinions on the Clayboy's music]
Oh my! This music does things to my brain!
It does things to my spine!
It makes me feel funny all over!
[Goo gives Lowbelly his lunch]
Here, Lowbelly. Here's your lunch.

[picks up the pearl Lowbelly cried earlier]
Oh, what a pretty marble!
[Goo returns to the table]

[showing Gumby the pearl]
Gumby, look at this strange marble I found in the hay. Isn't it beautiful?
[Goo gives the pearl to Gumby]
Gumby, look at this strange marble I found in the hay. Isn't it beautiful?

[examining the pearl]
It's a beauty alright; but I don't think it's a marble. It looks like a pearl!
[Gumby gives the pearl to Thinbuckle to examine]

[to Thinbuckle]
Here, Thinbuckle. What does it look like to you?

[after close examination]
It sure looks like a pearl my dad bought for my mother, and it cost a lotta money, man!
[Thinbuckle passes the pearl back to Gumby who then passes it over to Fatbuckle; Fatbuckle puts the pearl in his mouth and bites it]
[Fatbuckle takes the pearl out of his mouth and gives it back to Gumby]

[after examining the pearl]
I'll bet it's a real pearl! I'd say it's worth at least a thousand dollars!
Well, I'm gonna show it to Professor Kapp. He'll tell us if it's real for sure!
[Gumby visits Professor Kapp's lab and startles the professor]

[after knocking over a shelf filled with beakers and bunsen burners]
Oh, I'm awfully sorry, professor. I shouldn't pop in on you so fast like that.
Don't worry about that, son. It was just one of my many unsuccessful experiments. No harm done, really. Oh my! Well then, what can I do for you, Gumby?

[about the pearl]
Goo found this in our barn. We thought you could tell us if it's a real pearl or not.
[Gumby gives Professor Kapp the pearl]
Now, uh... let me get a good look at this with my crystal lazienalizer.
[Kapp places the pearl inside the analyzer as the machine analyzes it]

[pointing to the computer screen]
Oh, and on this screen over here, we'll soon get the answer.

[as the computer reads out the data]
Wow! Thank you, professor! This'll be a good start on our farmer's benefit fund. We are having a benefit concert in the park tomorrow, and you're invited!

[to Gumby; as he leaves his lab]
Oh, thank you, Gumby! I wouldn't miss it for anything!
